document_data.name: Caravance
document_data.mainbody: '''Caravance''' was a festival held in [[Waterdeep]] as part of the [[Waukeentide]] holiday.
document_data.Description: The festival celebrated the arrival of the first spring caravans to Waterdeep. During the day, celebrants hid gifts in their homes for their children to find, saying that [[Old Carvas]] had left them.
document_data.History:
The festival was named after the mythical figure of Old Carvas, an old peddler who was said to have arrived in the city with the first caravan, driving a wagon filled with toys that he distributed among Waterdhavian children.

Originally a separate holiday, Caravance was incorporated into Waukeentide and became the first of the [[tenday]]-long holiday's many festivities.
